description.narrative: Den Liberia Offentlig sektor moderniseringsprojekt syftar till att genomföra lönereform, öka effektivitet samt förbätre personal administrationen i de sju deltagande ministerierna i Liberia.

The Liberia Public Sector Modernization Project aims to improve pay and performance management in participating ministries, and strengthen payroll management in the Civil Service in Liberia. The project will benefit Liberian civil servants by improving transparency and predictability of salaries and human resource related issues such as career tracks, grade, recruitment & promotion.

Project overall objective
The project development objectives is 'improve pay and performance management in participating ministries, and strengthen payroll management in the Civil Service in Liberia'
The project will benefit Liberian civil servants by improving transparency and predictability of salaries and human resource related issues such as career tracks, grade, recruitment and promotion. The participating Ministries covered by the project include: Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Finance, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Health, Ministry of Internal Affairs, Ministry of Justice and Ministry of Information Cultural Affairs and Tourism. The seven Ministries constitute 75% of the civil servants of Liberia.
Project specific objectives: To achieve its overall objectives as stated above, the following specific objectives were defined: 1. Improve pay management in the participating ministries 2. Improve payroll management in the civil service 3. Improve performance in participating ministries 4. Improve opportunities for participation of female civil servants in decision making positions in the civil service

description.narrative: Implementation progress as at mid-term of the project was satisfactory. The one-employee-one-file process has been completed in all seven participating ministries. A new performance management system was introduced in the participating ministries. Biometric registration of civil servants in the participating ministries has started and CSA has begun re-issuing new biometric ID Cards to civil servants. The biometric identification system includes employees on the supplementary payroll (at the Ministry of Education and at the Ministry of Internal Affairs). Mandate and Functional Review reports were drafted and validated for Ministry of Justice, Ministry of Education, Ministry of Foreign Affairs, Ministry of Internal Affairs, Ministry of Information, Cultural Affairs and Tourism and the Ministry of Health. The Project Oversight Committee that was formed to provide strategic and policy guidance to the project has been active and meets on quarterly basis. The Year-0 Disbursement Linked Indicator (DLI) which was Preparation and Cabinet approval of Pay Strategy has been completed and an independent verification consultant produced a report to confirm the completion. The Year 1 DLI ( all participating ministries issued employment appointment letters to all their staff on personnel listing) was also completed. In addition, progress has been observed on DLI#3 (participating ministries have completed one annual cycle of the performance appraisal process for P & E grade civil servants). Completed annual cycle of the performance appraisal process includes the performance plan, progress review, employee self-assessment, pre-appraisal meeting and annual appraisal meetings; appraisal reviewed and finalized appraisal appeals process, finalization and decision made. The mid term review carried out at the end of 2017 found that the project was highly relevant to Liberia's development agenda. Despite this high relevance, sustainability of the results was questioned by the evaluation especially in the context of the need for firm political commitment and support to the project by the new administration after the elections. The project achieved other important unexpected results, including: -The Government of Liberia Pro-Poor Agenda for Prosperity and Development (PAPD) which is the national government development framework covering 2018-2023 provided specific recognition to the public sector reform priorities pursued by the project. The Government of Liberia underlined its commitment to strengthen public sector effectiveness through programs that foster equality and equity relating to employment, pay levels, pay grades and incentive based rewards in the civil service. In line with the Public Sector Modernization Project, the Government of Liberia further committed within the PAPD to expand the autonomy of the Civil Service Agency by revising the current legal framework to establish a Civil Service Commission. -In 2019, the Government of Liberia launched the Wage Bill Harmonization process which utilised some of the tools and lessons learnt in the implementation of the PSMP in 7 Ministries for roll out across 107 spending Government of Liberia entities. The goal of the Wage Bill Harmonization is to eliminate salary disparity within the civil service. The experience and tools from the implementation of the PSMP project has been drawn upon for this important exercise. -Building on the lessons learnt in the implementation of the PSMP Project, the Civil Service Agency has developed a strategic plan called the Civil Service Capability Plan (2019-2024). The development by the CSA of a strategic plan is a strong demonstration of commitment towards its institutional development in pursuit of the following objectives: Increasing Service Delivery Capability through CSA Decentralization from regional to county level; Enhancing Human Capital Capability; Improving Digital Transformation Capability for accountability; Improve service delivery; Establishing a Civil Service Commission to redefine the scope of the Civil Service and to apply operations, policy and regulatory authority in its new and improved form.
